item.title: Goldman Sachs sees shekel as overvalued
item.summary: Citing Iran war concerns and tech stock weakness, the Us investment bank recommends short positions on the Israeli currency.

item.title: El Al profit fell 26% in 2025 despite record revenue
item.summary: The stronger shekel, the war with Iran and the gradual return of foreign airlines all adversely affected the Israeli airline’s results.

item.title: Sheba climbs again in “Newsweek” world hospital top ten
item.summary: Four Israeli hospitals are ranked by “Newsweek” in the world’s top 250.

item.title: 16 agreements signed during Modi’s Israel visit
item.summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Israel as “short but very productive.”

item.title: Jensen Huang to visit Israel in April
item.summary: Nvidia's CEO will meet with the chip company's fast growing work force in Israel, which according to its latest financial report, has reached nearly 6,000.

item.title: Nvidia’s Israel networking unit reports $40b 2025 revenue
item.summary: Based on the acquisition of Mellanox, the networking division's revenue share of Nvidia's total revenue was 16% last year.

item.title: Gasoline prices to rise above NIS 7 per liter on Saturday night
item.summary: The maximum price of government price controlled 95 octane gasoline at self-service pumps in Israel will rise on Saturday at midnight March 1, 2026, by NIS 0.14 per liter to NIS 7.02 per liter.

item.title: Teddy Sagi returns to TASE with Alltrade Recycling
item.summary: The company, which recycles electrical and electronic waste, has raised NIS 150 million at a valuation of NIS 300 million.

item.title: Tax brackets reform to benefit higher earners
item.summary: The proposed income tax reform will only benefit those earning above NIS 16,000 per month.

item.title: Mizrahi Tefahot 2025 profit up 3.2%
item.summary: In the fourth quarter itself, the bank showed stronger growth in net profit of 7.5%, which amounted to NIS 1.4 billion.
